questions.text: My physical capability exceeds what my daily life requires — I have reserves for the unexpected.
I can physically help others (move, lift, serve) because I have capacity beyond my own needs.
My fitness level gives me options — I can hike, travel, play, work physically if needed.
I'm building physical capacity rather than just maintaining or losing it — investing, not just spending.
I have energy left at the end of the day — I'm not completely depleted by normal activities.
